title: U.S.-China Factory Breakup Is Hard to Do
text:
Chinese factories are suddenly looking a bit healthier. U.S. manufacturers aren’t. While some Beijing-based trade warriors may be gloating and Washington-based ones sulking, investors shouldn’t jump to conclusions.

The U.S. September factory purchasing managers index (PMI), released Tuesday by the Institute of Supply Management, was the worst since 2009. U.S. manufacturing has been trending down for a while and is likely to remain weak, thanks to a strong dollar and faltering global trade. Yet Tuesday’s alarming number can...
description: For the first time in a long time, U.S. factories look like they are doing even worse than Chinese ones.
